bug.short_desc: python2-pydot in F24 should Obsolete pydot from F23

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: The package pydot from F23 is now called python2-pydot in F24, but the Obsoletes is incorrect (python-pydot < 1.0.28-9.fc24 is Obsoleted), so the old pydot is not removed during an upgrade.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): pydot-1.0.28-9.fc24
How reproducible: always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. In F23 run: dnf system-upgrade download --releasever=24 --allowerasing 2. 3.
Actual results: Errors after packages are downloaded:
Running transaction check Transaction check succeeded. Running transaction test The downloaded packages were saved in cache until the next successful transaction. You can remove cached packages by executing 'dnf clean packages'. Error: Transaction check error: file /usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/dot_parser.py from install of python2-pydot-1.0.28-9.fc24.noarch conflicts with file from package pydot-1.0.28-7.fc23.noarch file /usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/dot_parser.pyc from install of python2-pydot-1.0.28-9.fc24.noarch conflicts with file from package pydot-1.0.28-7.fc23.noarch file /usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/dot_parser.pyo from install of python2-pydot-1.0.28-9.fc24.noarch conflicts with file from package pydot-1.0.28-7.fc23.noarch file /usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pydot.py from install of python2-pydot-1.0.28-9.fc24.noarch conflicts with file from package pydot-1.0.28-7.fc23.noarch file /usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pydot.pyc from install of python2-pydot-1.0.28-9.fc24.noarch conflicts with file from package pydot-1.0.28-7.fc23.noarch file /usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pydot.pyo from install of python2-pydot-1.0.28-9.fc24.noarch conflicts with file from package pydot-1.0.28-7.fc23.noarch
Expected results: No conflicts. pydot-1.0.28-7.fc23 should be removed in the upgrade transaction.
pydot-1.0.28-10.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-330be13c9d

pydot-1.0.28-10.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-330be13c9d
pydot-1.0.28-10.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
